did.unittitle: This being a suppliment [sic] of the Barracks bladder, of Co. B 339th Inf. ... / drawn by Wm. Henkelman. [192-?]

physdesc.extent: 1 map : ms., col. ; on sheet 46 x 61 cm.

did.abstract: Map created by a soldier in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Paul Baker, of Essexville, Michigan, in 1966 (Donor No. 4044).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., William Henkelman. This being a suppliment [sic] of the Barracks bladder, of Co. B 339th Inf., [192'?], Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: William Henkelman, of Wheeling, West Virginia, was a private in Company B., 339th U.S. Infantry, during the American intervention in North Russia, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

scopecontent.p: The collection contains a map (not drawn to scale) drawn by Henkelman showing Toulgas, Archangel District, Russia, with notes describing the battle of Nov. 11-14, 1918.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Infantry, 339th. Company B--Maps.
